intro: Pulmonaria chrysoblephara, commonly known as the golden lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of velvety, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, depending on the variety. It thrives in moist, shady woodland habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is also noted for its ability to tolerate partial shade and well-drained soil conditions.
